title: Project Proposal
text: This project seeks to emulate a karaoke machine by allowing a user to select from a set list of songs and displaying appropriately-timed lyrics accordingly. Additionally, once the song has finished, the project will grade the user’s performance — with both a numeric score and letter grade — based on how on-pitch they are.

title: Project Proposal
text: This project seeks to emulate a karaoke machine by allowing a user to select from a set list of songs and displaying appropriately-timed lyrics accordingly. Additionally, once the song has finished, the project will grade the user’s performance — with both a numeric score and letter grade — based on how on-pitch they are.

title: Project Proposal
text:
Specifications

Design allows the user to choose a song through external hardware
Design detects input notes between A3 and B5 (220 Hz to 1000 Hz)
Design scores the user’s singing by comparing detected and expected notes
Displays properly-timed notes/lyrics on an LCD
LCD display does not flicker

title: Project Proposal
text:
Design Details

New MCU Functionality


New FPGA Functionality


Non-Trivial New Hardware


Riskiest Element
The riskiest element of the project will likely be integrating the aforementioned microphone decimation involving CIC and FIR filters; at the moment, the team does not know anything about this, nor how to implement it, so it is hard to assess both the amount and difficulty of the workload before actually diving into it. Furthermore, the decimation will have to be done using the FPGA, which means that there is less library support in the case that any complicated software needs to be configured.
